mBeanAttr.name: Notes
mBeanAttr.dicommon:value: SMP JSR 264 implementation JVT event topic

mBeanAttr.name: Notes
mBeanAttr.dicommon:value: SMP JSR 264 implementation XVT event topic

mBeanAttr.name: Notes
mBeanAttr.dicommon:value: SMP JSR 264 implementation JMS request queue

mBeanAttr.name: Notes
mBeanAttr.dicommon:value: SMP JSR 264 implementation error queue for JMS request queue

mBeanAttr.name: Notes
mBeanAttr.dicommon:value: SMP JSR 264 implementation JMS response queue

mBeanAttr.name: Notes
mBeanAttr.dicommon:value: Queue for notify project status changed

property.name: log4j.properties
property.dicommon:value: $LOG4J_ROOT_CATEGORY $LOG4J_STDOUT_APPENDER $LOG4J_ALARM_APPENDER $LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER log4j.appender.Rollover.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM@$WL_SERVER_NAME.log log4j.appender.Alarm.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/alarm.log log4j.appender.Alarm.ModuleName=$PROGRAM log4j.appender.Alarm.Script=$WL_WORKING_DIR/util/samp_alarm.sh # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Here you can configure the level of logging per package/class # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- $LOG4J_PACKAGE_LOGLEVEL

property.name: jwf_engine_session_jndi
property.dicommon:description: jndi name of jwf session bean handling jea reply task, required if use_install_dist_cfg is false

property.name: jwf_container_password
property.dicommon:description: password used to connect to jwf url

property.name: jwf_port
property.dicommon:description: port to j2ee container which jwf is running,required if use_install_dist_cfg is false

property.name: jwf_host
property.dicommon:description: host to j2ee container which jwf is running,required if use_install_dist_cfg is false

property.name: jwf_container_user
property.dicommon:description: user name used to connect to jwf url

property.name: use_install_dist_cfg
property.dicommon:description: false means using user defined values; true means get jwf destination from install/distribution configuration.

property.name: log4j.properties
property.dicommon:value:
$LOG4J_ROOT_CATEGORY $LOG4J_STDOUT_APPENDER $LOG4J_ALARM_APPENDER $LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER log4j.appender.Rollover.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM@$WL_SERVER_NAME.log log4j.appender.Alarm.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/alarm.log log4j.appender.Alarm.ModuleName=$PROGRAM log4j.appender.Alarm.Script=$WL_WORKING_DIR/util/samp_alarm.sh
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Configure appender for messages produced by Log and alarm activites # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- log4j.appender.wflog=org.apache.log4j.DailyRollingFileAppender log4j.appender.wflog.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM-msg.log log4j.appender.wflog.DatePattern='.'yyyy-MM-dd log4j.appender.wflog.layout=com.sigma.hframe.jlog.SigmaPatternLayout log4j.appender.wflog.layout.ConversionPattern=%p %d{HH:mm:ss} %T %c> %m%n log4j.category.Process=DEBUG , wflog
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Here you can configure the level of logging per package/class # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- $LOG4J_PACKAGE_LOGLEVEL

property.name: log4j.properties
property.dicommon:value: $LOG4J_ROOT_CATEGORY $LOG4J_STDOUT_APPENDER $LOG4J_ALARM_APPENDER $LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER log4j.appender.Rollover.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM@$WL_SERVER_NAME.log log4j.appender.Alarm.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/alarm.log log4j.appender.Alarm.ModuleName=$PROGRAM log4j.appender.Alarm.Script=$WL_WORKING_DIR/util/samp_alarm.sh # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Here you can configure the level of logging per package/class # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- $LOG4J_PACKAGE_LOGLEVEL $LOG4J_SYSTIMER_DEFAULT

property.name: treeLoadTimeout
property.dicommon:description: Timeout for asynchronous calls performed by ExtJs subscriber and orders trees. Milliseconds.

property.name: orderTreeMaxLineItemsToShow
property.dicommon:description: Maximum number of order line items to show in the order tree. If more than that, only a link to the order details page will be shown.

property.name: log4j.properties
property.dicommon:value: $LOG4J_ROOT_CATEGORY $LOG4J_STDOUT_APPENDER $LOG4J_ALARM_APPENDER $LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER log4j.appender.Rollover.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM@$WL_SERVER_NAME.log log4j.appender.Alarm.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/alarm.log log4j.appender.Alarm.ModuleName=$PROGRAM log4j.appender.Alarm.Script=$WL_WORKING_DIR/util/samp_alarm.sh # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Here you can configure the level of logging per package/class # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- $LOG4J_PACKAGE_LOGLEVEL

property.name: DFLT_JMS_CONN_FACTORY
property.dicommon:description: jndi name of the default jms conn factory

property.name: BACKUP_TASK
property.dicommon:description: should the framework back tasks if the adapter uses synchronous protocols?

property.name: rtstate.MAX_ADPT_EVENT_ROWS
property.dicommon:description: max number of adapter events cached by the adapter console

property.name: rtstate.MAX_CONN_EVENT_ROWS
property.dicommon:description: max number of conn events cached by the adapter console

property.name: rtstate.MAX_TASK_EVENT_ROWS
property.dicommon:description: max number of task events cached by the adapter console

property.name: CONSOLE_JMS_SELECTOR
property.dicommon:description: jms receiver selector used by the adapter console

property.name: JEA_NON_TX_DATASOURCE
property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.name: JEA_TX_DATASOURCE
property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.name: JEA_P1
property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.dicommon:description: max number of adapter events cached by the adapter console

property.name: rtstate.MAX_CONN_EVENT_ROWS
property.dicommon:description: max number of conn events cached by the adapter console

property.name: rtstate.MAX_TASK_EVENT_ROWS
property.dicommon:description: max number of task events cached by the adapter console

property.name: CONSOLE_JMS_SELECTOR
property.dicommon:description: jms receiver selector used by the adapter console

property.name: JEA_NON_TX_DATASOURCE
property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.name: JEA_TX_DATASOURCE
property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.name: JEA_P1
property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.name: log4j.properties
property.dicommon:value: $LOG4J_ROOT_CATEGORY $LOG4J_STDOUT_APPENDER $LOG4J_ALARM_APPENDER $LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER log4j.appender.Rollover.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM@$WL_SERVER_NAME.log log4j.appender.Alarm.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/alarm.log log4j.appender.Alarm.ModuleName=$PROGRAM log4j.appender.Alarm.Script=$WL_WORKING_DIR/util/samp_alarm.sh # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Here you can configure the level of logging per package/class # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- $LOG4J_PACKAGE_LOGLEVEL

property.dicommon:description: jndi name of the default jms conn factory

property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.name: JEA_TX_DATASOURCE
property.dicommon:description: test jea property

property.name: log4j.properties
property.dicommon:value: $LOG4J_ROOT_CATEGORY $LOG4J_STDOUT_APPENDER $LOG4J_ALARM_APPENDER $LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER log4j.appender.Rollover.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM@$WL_SERVER_NAME.log log4j.appender.Alarm.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/alarm.log log4j.appender.Alarm.ModuleName=$PROGRAM log4j.appender.Alarm.Script=$WL_WORKING_DIR/util/samp_alarm.sh # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Here you can configure the level of logging per package/class # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- $LOG4J_PACKAGE_LOGLEVEL $LOG4J_SYSTIMER_DEFAULT

property.name: log4j.properties
property.dicommon:value: $LOG4J_ROOT_CATEGORY $LOG4J_STDOUT_APPENDER $LOG4J_ALARM_APPENDER $LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER log4j.appender.Rollover.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/$PROGRAM@$WL_SERVER_NAME.log log4j.appender.Alarm.File=$WL_WORKING_DIR/log/alarm.log log4j.appender.Alarm.ModuleName=$PROGRAM log4j.appender.Alarm.Script=$WL_WORKING_DIR/util/samp_alarm.sh # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Here you can configure the level of logging per package/class # --------------------------------------------------------------------------- $LOG4J_PACKAGE_LOGLEVEL $LOG4J_SYSTIMER_DEFAULT

property.name: JWF_CONTAINER_URL
property.dicommon:description: used by the JEAs to connect to jwf/queues etc

property.name: CONTAINER_URL
property.dicommon:description: used by the JEAs to connect to jwf/queues etc

property.name: THREAD_COUNT
property.dicommon:description: used to configure thread count for this server/node

property.name: LOG4J_ROLLOVER_APPENDER
property.dicommon:value: # Roll the logs every hour, don't change this pattern, otherwise the trace_order.sh won't work properly log4j.appender.Rollover=org.apache.log4j.DailyRollingFileAppender log4j.appender.Rollover.DatePattern='.'yyyy-MM-dd-HH log4j.appender.Rollover.layout=com.sigma.hframe.jlog.SigmaPatternLayout log4j.appender.Rollover.layout.ConversionPattern=%p %d{HH:mm:ss} %T %c> %m%n
